…time travel plus moving through space is not gravity…. As I’m sure the reader is already aware, gravity is generated by all objects that have “rest mass,” meaning that any object that requires a force to accelerate it (make it move faster OR slower). Einstein treated this as a curve in 4-dimensional space and said that it was similar to setting weights on a trampoline’s surface. In both cases, the more massive the object the more curvature and the more curvature the more acceleration experienced by nearby objects. Information about the gravity and/or the gravity itself appears to move at the speed of light. For this and other reasons, gravity appears to be linked to electricity and magnetism in a way that is not yet understood. Why all objects create gravity is also not yet understood. Perhaps you, dear reader, will pickup the challenge, get a degree in physics, and continue the research in this field?

Gravitational pull is the hidden force that causes massive objects to pull other objects towards them. For instance, when a person jumps up in the air, it is the earth’s gravitational pull that causes him to return to the ground. All massive objects have gravity, and the bigger they are, the more gravitational pull they produce.When a mass is present in the above space time it distorts it so that whilst it remains true that traveling through space causes you to travel through time, traveling through time now causes you to move (accelerate) through space. In other words just by existing, you are compelled to move through space - this is gravity.

Scott is correct. We experience gravity as an attractive force. The earth, for example, is pulling meteorites in to be vaporized in the atmosphere or crash onto the surface. But Einstein showed us that it is not a force, as such. Instead, objects warp space and time. Think of a circular or funnel-shaped dip in a surface; like potholes in a road. It may seem like the pothole is pulling your wheel toward it, but in reality, the wheel is just following the curvature of the surface it’s rolling over.

Well the best answer was provided by Einstein. In a nutshell, gravitational pull is caused by curvature in space-time. According to Einstein’s General Relativity, matter curves space (and time too) around it. And hence objects which are nearby would fall in because of the downward slope created by the planet. Newtonian mechanics has a simpler interpretation but general relativity is more correct and reliable .
